text: around a thousand people a day are
fleeing Zimbabwe sneaking across the
Limpopo River the natural boundary
between the two countries they wade
through murky water braving the snakes
hippos and crocodiles when they make it
to the other side they have three layers
of barbed wire to wiggle through
frequently patrolled by South African
soldiers here we are at the border of
south africa in Zimbabwe and as you can
see some places in this border fence
have been cut this is a passageway for
people fleeing Zimbabwe to enter South
Africa illegally this fence which is
made out of very sharp razor wire has
been cut underneath the fence has been
dug out people are able to crawl from
over there which is in Bob way across
here and into South Africa once revered
for its powerhouse economy Zimbabwe has
become a crumbling mess the country now
suffers from one of the highest
inflation rates in the world and the
harsh autocracy of President Robert
Mugabe the recent crackdown since
Zimbabwe's flawed election on March 29th
seems to be driving even more people
away mr. Mugabe and his ruling party
zanu-pf have not even allow the election
